description:
Takahara Hairi never expected summer to feel like a dream. Sent to Torishirojima Island to sort through his late grandmother’s belongings, he’s met with endless sea, quiet nostalgia, and mysterious girls, each chasing something just out of reach. As he settles into island life, lost memories begin to surface and he finds what he never knew he’d lost.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Table Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of table tennis (also known as "ping pong").

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

node.description:
Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nsimayu)

A visual novel scenario writer who is famous for writing "Nakige," games that are supposed to make you cry. His most notable works are _Hatsuyuki Sakura_, _Natsuyume Nagisa_, and _Summer Pockets_.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.
Ryo Mizutsuki is a Japanese composer and lyricist. She is best known for her compositions on Key works, most notably heavily contributing to the soundtracks of Rewrite and Summer Pockets.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.

**Doujin Circle:** Stardust Cradle (すたーだすとくれいどる)

[Website](http://star-cradle.itigo.jp/) | [Pixiv](http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=149587) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yama913)

__[Website](http://hisuitei.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasu_izumi)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://tsubasu.blog6.fc2.com/)__

__Date of Birth:__ May 8, ????
__Residency:__ Close to Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture, Japan
__Likes:__ Cats

__Izumi Tsubasu__ is a Japanese freelance illustrator who has illustrated for the anime and video game industry, she is also an active member of the doujin circle 翡翠亭 (Hisuitei).

She is best known for her active involvement in the Mashiroiro Symphony series, being the illustrative artist for most of the works.
